name: Searcy's Roof Garden Rooms

reviews.text: my second stay lovely went for a shopping weekend felt like i was staying in harrods back garden brilliant location enjoyed every minute staff where great thankyou be back again saw you on MADE IN CHELSEA brilliant
reviews.title: lovely hotel

reviews.text: Stayed here for the second time. Very pleased again.
reviews.title: feel at home in london

reviews.text: Very cosy and comfortable rooms. Absolutely perfect welcome, friendly helpfull staff, very clean and wih eye for details. Central location, close to Picadilly line.
reviews.title: Cozy places to stay in the heart of Knightsbridge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice breakfast served in the room with a smile.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean, Convenient and Friendly

reviews.text: Was lucky enough to get an upgrade to a suite and was sorry not to be staying longer. Very comfortable, pleasant stay. Staff were pleasant and helpful, breakfast was lovely. Will certainly stay here again
reviews.title: A great place to stay in central London

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed here a number of times - either alone or with a partner. The most recent was in November 2011 for three nights.
reviews.title: Upmarket Bed & Breakfast

reviews.text: New visitors are sometimes confused by this hotel but nobody can fail to be charmed by its quirky originality. Yes perhaps it can be argued that the elevator needs an overhaul, and there is never many staff around (but then there are not many rooms) but I would not have it any other way.
reviews.title: Great for a weekend in Knightsbridge

reviews.text: This is one of London's original Boutique Hotels. Do not go here if you want an all night Bar and an upmaket restauant. Probably not that suitable for Children either. This is essentially a very nice, and rather exclusive, Bed & Breakfast in the heart of Knightsbridge.
reviews.title: Pound for pound you won't get better

reviews.text: I will continue to use it whenever ihn London.
reviews.title: not what advertised.... at £ 220 !!!

reviews.text: This place is a bit like a speakeasy, with an elevator that opens directly onto the street and very discreet signage. The location in Knightsbridge (a block and a half behind Harrods) is fantastic. I've stayed here twice - once with the family and once on business. Depending on the time of year and what's going on in London, you can find some good deals here (usually listed on the website). The rooms are small but well appointed with nice bathrooms (and good water pressure in the shower). The staff is very friendly and helpful. In good weather the terrace is fantastic for breakfast. I'll stay there again to be sure.
reviews.title: Shhh! Don't tell anyone about this little gem of a place ;-)
Quiet little hotel.
reviews.text: Unusual and quiet little hotel very conveniently located right in the heart of Knightsbridge. The rooms are not large but very comfortable and not too expensive. The breakfast was good and the staff friendly.Getting in and out with the unusual lift can be a challenge sometimes but overall a good place to stay.

A quaint little hotel accessed through a nearly unmarked door into an ancient lift hardly a hundred yards from Harrods. Inside the rooms are clean and comfortable and the service excellent. It is a bit more like a bed and breakfast with no bar or dining room, roof terrace apparently is used for breakfast though clearly not in December. The location is excellent, close to Knightsbridge tube station, with Harrods etc. just a short walk. It is an ideal place to stay when you have things to do and want a convenient base.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very attractive: two minutes from Harrods and the Knightsbridge underground station (and just in face there is the Embassy of Ecuador, now famous courtesy of Mr Assange). You enter through a 19th century strange elevator, with the key they will provide to you, and are in fact inside an old English home - nice but not particularly fancy. The breakfast is good but with limited choice. The bathroom in what was supposed to be a superior room was quite old and not renovated too recently. The staff is co-operative and mostly made of beautiful Lithuanian girls. For the basic services it offers it's a bit expensive, but this is London and nothing is cheap.
reviews.title: Good location, very basic services - and quite expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very nice small hotel located in Knightsbridge, but in a quiet back road. There's no "lobby", as you enter through an elevator that takes you either to your room floor or to the 3rd floor, where the reception is located. Beds are large and comfortable, reasonable amount of space, a good breakfast (that you select the day before and is taken either to your room or to a nice roof terrace), helpful staff, price quite reasonable (for London's preposterous standards). Can't really think of anything to complain about. A good option if you want to stay in this neighborhood.
reviews.title: Very nice, very convenient, zero problems

reviews.text: This was a really nice hotel. We stayed for three nights and everything was just perfect. The two rooms we had were charming and comfortable with some funny features (the bath was in the bedroom - not a separate bathroom).
reviews.title: Great atmosphere

reviews.text: The breakfast was great and it was nice to have it in our room. The location is perfect as the Harrods and the underground is just a few steps from the hotel.
reviews.title: vacation

reviews.text: I shall surely choose this hotel in the future as well!
reviews.title: My little haven

reviews.text: very nice staff and quite little oasis in the midst of London. would go back there although things are 'tiny' overall. breakfast on the rooftop topped it all though!!!
reviews.title: As good as ever

description: Roof Garden Rooms is situated in the heart of Knightsbridge. Originally an old pumping station, it has been transformed into a tasteful hotel with a rooftop garden. There is a relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff with a high level of personal and attentive service. It is perfect for people seeking an alternative to large hotel chains. Upstairs there are 11 charming country house style bedrooms.
